#summary The line-height property specifies the minimal height of line boxes within the element.
#labels about-css,is-css-property,from-w3c

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [CSSReference CSS Reference] > [CSSProperties Properties] > *line-height*

== Usage ==

== Values ==

  * `normal`
  * [CSSNumberType <number>]
  * [CSSLengthType <length>]
  * [CSSPercentageType <percentage>]
  * `inherit`

== Browser compatibility ==

|| *Test* || *IE8* || *IE7* || *FF3* || *FF2* || *Saf3* ||

== Bugs ==
Firefox 3rc3 renders a line's height 1px taller then every single other browser and version so make sure to set the line-height in any cases where your position and alignment relies on (the previously consistent) line-height.
